titleStmt.title: A discourse of things above reason· Inquiring whether a philosopher should admit there are any such. By a Fellow of the Royal Society· To which are annexed by the publisher (for the affinity of the subjects) some advices about judging of things said to transcend reason. Written by a Fellow of the same Society.
titleStmt.author: Boyle, Robert, 1627-1691.
Fellow of the same Society. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by E.T. and R.H. for Jonathan Robinson at the Golden Lion in S. Paul's Church-Yard,

notesStmt.note: Part 1 is by Robert Boyle; the authorship of part 2 is not established.
"Advices in judging of things said to transcend reason" (caption title) begins new pagination on 2A1.
In this issue, p.100 has 22 lines of text; last line reads "ciples of cosmography.".
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: the Golden Lion in S. Paul's Church-Yard
